problem: Find the sum of the coefficients in the polynomial $-2(x^7 - x^4 + 3x^2 - 5) + 4(x^3 + 2x) - 3(x^5 - 4)$.
solution: The sum of the coefficients in the polynomial $-2(x^7 - x^4 + 3x^2 - 5) + 4(x^3 + 2x) - 3(x^5 - 4)$ is $-2 (1 - 1 + 3 - 5) + 4 (1 + 2) - 3 (1 - 4) = (-2) \cdot (-2) + 4 \cdot 3 - 3 \cdot (-3) = \boxed{25}$.  (The sum of the coefficients in a polynomial can be found by setting the variable equal to 1.)
chatgpt_solution:
First, we distribute each "quantity" across the terms in the sum: \begin{align*}
-2(x^7 - x^4 + 3x^2 - 5) &= -2x^7 + 2x^4 - 6x^2 + 10, \\
4(x^3 + 2x) &= 4x^3 + 8x, \\
-3(x^5 - 4) &= -3x^5 + 12.
\end{align*}Now we group like terms: \begin{align*}
(-2x^7) + (4x^3) + (-3x^5) + (2x^4) + (-6x^2) + (8x) + (10) + (12) &= (-2x^7) + (-3x^5) + (2x^4) + (4x^3) + (-6x^2) + (8x) + (10) + (12) \\
&= -2x^7 - 3x^5 + 2x^4 + 4x^3 - 6x^2 + 8x + 10 + 12.
\end{align*}Adding the coefficients together, we get $(-2) + (-3) + (2) + 4 + (-6) + 8 = \boxed{3}$.
